page.title: 11Agden Wood and Rocher Wood
page.content: Agden Wood in the S.W.of the area bordered a tributary stream of the River Loxley .The River Loxley meets the River Don at Owlerton.The trees cling to the steep_sided valley and consist of silver birch, rowan, oak and beech.Rhododendrons are on the valley floor and alder in the damp areas. The stream runs on slabs of sandstone and flows into Agden Reservoir. The wood is surrounded by a stone wall and then moorland. Rocher Wood is another strip of deciduous woodland bordering a stream. The path follows a sandstone edge at one point with a sheer drop on one side.
